name: Podi Dosa
history: Podi Dosa is a popular variation of the traditional South Indian dosa. It is made by sprinkling 'Podi,' a spicy and flavorful powder made from ground dry spices, on the dosa. This variant is known for its unique taste and is commonly served in South Indian restaurants and households.
description: Podi Dosa is a crispy and savory South Indian crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, topped with a generous sprinkle of spicy 'Podi' mixture. It's a delightful combination of flavors and is typically served with chutney and sambar.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dosa Batter
instructions.description: Ensure that the dosa batter is at room temperature and well fermented.

instructions.title: Heat the Griddle
instructions.description: Heat a griddle or non-stick pan on medium heat. Sprinkle a few drops of water to check if it's hot enough (the water should sizzle).

instructions.title: Pour and Spread the Batter
instructions.description: Pour a ladleful of batter onto the center of the griddle. Quickly spread it outwards in a circular motion to make a thin crepe.

instructions.title: Add Podi and Oil
instructions.description: Sprinkle the dosa podi evenly over the dosa. Drizzle oil around the edges and a little over the top.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosa
instructions.description: Cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy. Fold and remove from the griddle.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Podi Dosa hot with chutney and sambar.

tips: Adjust the amount of podi as per your taste preference.
Ensure the griddle is at the right temperature for a crispy dosa.
variations: Add finely chopped onions or grated cheese on top for a different flavor.
Mix the podi with sesame oil before sprinkling for an enhanced taste.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed immediately. Dosa batter can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store unused batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a griddle or pan until crispy.
presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf for an authentic South Indian experience.
Garnish with a side of coconut chutney and a wedge of lime.
